Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: `net7.0-android` does not show as a computed compatible framework for a `net6.0-android` package" (#9711) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Describe the bug

The "Frameworks" tab for a `net6.0-android` NuGet package does not show `net7.0-android` as a computed compatible framework.  This leads users to believe that our packages our not usable by .NET 7 Android apps.

Example:
https://www.nuget.org/packages/Xamarin.AndroidX.Core#supportedframeworks-body-tab

Note it is likely caused by the additional Android version in the moniker.  For example, `net7.0-android` shows up as a computed framework for Json.NET:

https://www.nuget.org/packages/Newtonsoft.Json#supportedframeworks-body-tab

Also note we only specify `net6.0-android` in our `.csproj` file, the Android version is added automatically by `pack`:

https://github.com/xamarin/AndroidX/blob/main/Directory.Build.props#L9

### Repro Steps

Open URL: https://www.nuget.org/packages/Xamarin.AndroidX.Core#supportedframeworks-body-tab

### Expected Behavior

`net7.0-android` should be listed as an "Additional computed target framework(s)".

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Fixing popularity transfer download count bug, surfacing additional validation info" (#9710) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
The Popularity Transfer Admin Panel has a bug where it shows version-specific download counts for packages, rather than the package registration's download count, which is what we want (we transfer popularity from one package registration to another). I had to refactor some code to get that data correctly.

I also added some more validation info to the Admin Panel page, which should save DRIs from having to go look in the SQL DB manually every time: 
![image](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/assets/82980589/2650b9a4-7113-429b-8f71-1dcf02f1f2a6)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: Incorrect download number in Most Downloaded Packages page" (#9709) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Describe the bug

I'm checking the ranking of MimeKit in https://www.nuget.org/stats/packages page. But I notice a weird thing. The downloads in this page is different from the one on [MimeKit homepage]().

![image](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/assets/772561/f89f87c5-477b-4148-8b0c-903226133eda)

This is the number on MimeKit homepage
![image](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/assets/772561/cc0544a6-136e-4e99-b0dd-917e599fc5ec)

Can you double check your distinct logic? I'm afraid it's a bug.


### Repro Steps

1. Go to https://www.nuget.org/stats/packages
2. Pick any package and record the download number
3. Go inside to the package homepage and record the total download number


### Expected Behavior

The download number on stats/packages page should be same as the one on package homepage

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: SSH.NET download count issue" (#9708) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: ### Impact Other ### Describe the bug Two days ago I released a new version of SSH.NET, but the download counter still shows **0**: https://www.nuget.org/packages/SSH.NET/2023.0.0 I have downloaded this package many times and updated it in other open source projects. ### Repro Steps Open page https://www.nuget.org/packages/SSH.NET/2023.0.0 ### Expected Behavior The counter should be greater then 0. ### Screenshots ### Additional Context and logs For instance I've updated this package in the following projects. https://github.com/testcontainers/testcontainers-dotnet/pull/1019 https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG/pull/2503 Both examples build in Github Actions.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: IP blocked by globalcdn.nuget.org" (#9707) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

I'm unable to use NuGet.org

### Describe the bug

It seems that one of our public export IP `216.52.208.43` is blocked and cannot connect to `globalcdn.nuget.org` normally.
I tested other public export IPs and it was normal.

### Repro Steps

1. download package <https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/package/coverlet.msbuild/2.6.2>
2. cannot connect to globalcdn.nuget.org
3. finally get a 502 after 60s

### Expected Behavior

Hope it can be downloaded normally.

We are using JFrog Artifactory as an internal NuGet proxy and cache, and it has been working fine for the past few years.
I noticed that `globalcdn.nuget.org` was only started to be used recently. Are there some configurations that need to be optimized?

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context and logs

curl -vv -L "https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/package/coverlet.msbuild/2.6.2"
> CONNECT www.nuget.org:443 HTTP/1.1
> Host: www.nuget.org:443
> User-Agent: curl/7.68.0
> Proxy-Connection: Keep-Alive
> 
< HTTP/1.0 200 Connection established
< 
> GET /api/v2/package/coverlet.msbuild/2.6.2 HTTP/1.1
> Host: www.nuget.org
> User-Agent: curl/7.68.0
> Accept: */*
> 
< HTTP/1.1 302 Found
< Cache-Control: private
< Transfer-Encoding: chunked
< Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8
< Location: https://globalcdn.nuget.org/packages/coverlet.msbuild.2.6.2.nupkg
< Access-Control-Expose-Headers: Request-Context
< Set-Cookie: ARRAffinity=03653a5ff26f7e0adf0cd33338b896ea4ee4856ba3918ba0940d9b1fda36f29c;Path=/;HttpOnly;Secure;Domain=www.nuget.org
< Set-Cookie: ARRAffinitySameSite=03653a5ff26f7e0adf0cd33338b896ea4ee4856ba3918ba0940d9b1fda36f29c;Path=/;HttpOnly;SameSite=None;Secure;Domain=www.nuget.org
< Strict-Transport-Security: max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains
< Request-Context: appId=cid-v1:338f6804-b1a9-4fe3-bba7-c93064e7ae7b
< Content-Security-Policy: frame-ancestors 'none'
< X-Frame-Options: DENY
< X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: Advisories removed from GitHub still appear on NuGet.org" (#9706) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Describe the bug

At least one security advisory link on NuGet.org is broken. When you click it, GitHub shows a 404.

https://www.nuget.org/packages/bootstrap/4.2.1
links to
https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-fxwm-579q-49qq

```kusto
let advisory = "GHSA-fxwm-579q-49qq";
NiCatalogLeafItems
| where Vulnerabilities contains advisory
| summarize min(CommitTimestamp)
```

|min_CommitTimestamp|
|---|
|2020-07-17 07:21:57.4073455|

We first saw this advisory in July of 2020. It's not clear at what time the page began showing 404. Wayback Machine has no index for this.

We don't know if this is a GitHub data bug or something else.























### Repro Steps

https://www.nuget.org/packages/bootstrap/4.2.1
links to
https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-fxwm-579q-49qq

This GitHub URL is 404.

### Expected Behavior

The link should not be there if the advisory is withdrawn or the link should work.

The VerifyGitHubVulnerabilities job should report this as an error since we have an advisory in our DB that doesn't exist on GitHub (anymore?).

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[ReleasePrep][2023.10.09]FI of main into dev" (#9705) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Closed issue "The NuGet.org repository signing certificate will be updated as soon as March 15th, 2021" (#53) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
The current NuGet.org repository signing certificate will be updated as soon as March 15th, 2021. If you validate that packages are repository signed by NuGet.org using a [NuGet client policy](https://docs.microsoft.com/nuget/consume-packages/installing-signed-packages), the [`NuGet.exe verify`](https://docs.microsoft.com/nuget/reference/cli-reference/cli-ref-verify) command, or the [`dotnet nuget verify`](https://docs.microsoft.com/dotnet/core/tools/dotnet-nuget-verify) command, you will need to take steps by March 15th, 2021 to avoid disruptions when installing packages from NuGet.org that are signed with the new certificate. 

If you are unsure if you will be impacted or want to see instructions to allow the new certificate, please see our blogpost on the matter: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/nuget/the-nuget-org-repository-signing-certificate-will-be-updated-as-soon-as-march-15th-2021/

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "The Microsoft author-signing certificate will be updated as soon as August 14th, 2023" (#70) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
The current Microsoft author-signing certificate will be updated as soon as August 14th, 2023.  If you validate that packages are author signed by Microsoft using a [NuGet client policy](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/consume-packages/installing-signed-packages) or the [`verify`](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/reference/cli-reference/cli-ref-verify) command, you will need to take steps to avoid disruptions when installing Microsoft packages signed with the new certificate.

If you are unsure if you will be impacted or want to see instructions to allow the new certificate, please see our blog post on the matter: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/nuget/microsoft-author-signing-certificate-update-2023/
